page.title: 01SYDMONTON IN GENERAL
page.content:
SYDMONTON IN 1985 IS A VERY RURAL AREA. THE MAIN ACTIVITY IS FARMING. THIS FARMING IS VERY COST CONSCIOUS. HALF THE FARMING LAND IS OWNED BY PRUDENTIAL ASSURANCE AS INVESTMENT. IT IS MAINLY ARABLE & MANAGED IN LARGE UNITS WHICH HAVE BEEN FORMED BY GROUPING SEVERAL SMALLER FIELDS TOGETHER. THIS HAS HAD SEVERAL EFFECTS: MANY PUBLIC FOOTPATHS ARE OVERGROWN; FEW DWELLINGS ARE OCCUPIED BY PEOPLE WORKING ON THE LAND. INDEED, MANY FORMER TIED COTTAGES ARE OWNED BY PEOPLE WHO WORK OUT OF THE AREA.
SYDMONTON HAS FREQUENT VISITORS BECAUSE THE DOWNS ARE ATTRACTIVE RECREATIONAL AREAS, BUT FOR PEOPLE WHO LIVE HERE, THERE ARE VERY FEW AMENITIES. THEY HAVE TO TRAVEL OUT OF THE AREA FOR WORK, SCHOOL, MEDICAL ATTENTION & ENTERTAINMENT.
